description: Comprehensive scenario pack for all manufacturing and industrial operations

scenarios.SA: Operator notices machine vibration change but doesn't connect to bearing wear progression.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to stop production line for quality concern vs. continue and inspect.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating equipment anomaly to maintenance and supervision.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating line changeover between production and setup crews.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team morale during mandatory overtime period.
scenarios.HF: Attention to detail degradation during repetitive assembly task.

scenarios.SA: Technician completing PM doesn't notice wear indicator on adjacent component.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to attempt repair vs. wait for parts during production downtime.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating repair timeline to production for schedule adjustment.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating complex repair with production, safety, and contractors.
scenarios.LEAD: Maintenance manager prioritizing work orders during equipment emergency.
scenarios.HF: Lockout/tagout compliance accuracy during rushed repair.

scenarios.SA: Inspector reviews sample but doesn't connect to upstream process drift.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to hold product for additional testing vs. release to customer.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating quality hold to production, shipping, and customer service.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating root cause investigation across multiple departments.
scenarios.LEAD: Quality manager balancing customer deadline with product conformance.
scenarios.HF: Inspection accuracy during high-volume production periods.

scenarios.SA: Forklift operator notices load shift but doesn't anticipate stability issue.

scenarios.COMM: Communicating inventory discrepancy to purchasing and production.

scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team during peak shipping period with tight deadlines.
scenarios.HF: Picking accuracy during high-volume order fulfillment.

scenarios.SA: Engineer reviews process data but doesn't connect variation to equipment change.

scenarios.LEAD: Engineering manager balancing multiple project priorities with limited resources.
scenarios.HF: Design review thoroughness under project deadline pressure.

scenarios.COMM: Communicating safety requirements to contractors unfamiliar with site.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating emergency response drill with production schedule.
scenarios.LEAD: Safety manager addressing safety culture issues in specific department.
scenarios.HF: Hazard recognition accuracy during routine workplace inspection.

scenarios.SA: Planner monitors inventory but doesn't anticipate supplier lead time change impact.

scenarios.LEAD: Supply chain manager managing vendor relationship during quality dispute.

scenarios.SA: Planner reviews schedule but doesn't anticipate downstream bottleneck.

scenarios.TW: Coordinating schedule adjustment with production, quality, and maintenance windows.
scenarios.LEAD: Planning manager balancing customer commitments with capacity constraints.

scenarios.LEAD: Shift supervisor managing team response to process emergency.

scenarios.TW: Coordinating utility shutdown with production schedule and safety.
scenarios.LEAD: Facilities manager prioritizing repairs during multiple system issues.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Equipment Failure
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Critical production equipment fails. Requires coordination of repair, quality hold evaluation, schedule adjustment, and customer communication.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Quality Escape
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Quality issue discovered after product shipped. Requires containment, investigation, customer notification, and corrective action.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Process Upset
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Process excursion creates safety and quality concerns. Requires emergency response, safe shutdown, and root cause investigation.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Rush Order
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: High-priority customer order requires expedited production. Requires schedule adjustment, quality verification, and shipping coordination.
